citation.article-title: Lactobacillus panis sp. nov., from sourdough with a long fermentation period.

p.s: Description of Lactobacillus panis sp. nov.
Lactobacillus panis (pa'nis. L. masc. gen. n.panis, of bread)
Cells are rod shaped (0.7 to 0.9 by 2.5 to 6 μm) and form chains or clusters.
Colonies are white to grey, convex, smooth, and up to 2 mm in diameter.
Grows at 30 and 45°C but not at 15°C.
Heterofermentative, producing D- and L-lactic acids.
Acid is produced from L-arabinose, fructose, galactose, glucose, lactose, maltose, D-mannose, melibiose, α-methybglucoside, β-methybxyloside, raffinose, D-ribose, salicin, sucrose, and D-xylose.

Acid is not produced from N-acetyl-glucosamine, amidon, D-arabinose, arabitol, cellobiose, erythritol, fucose, galactitol, glycerol, glycogen, inositol, inulin, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, D-lyxose, mannitol, melezitose, α-methylmannoside, L-rhamnose, L-sorbose, D-tagatose, trehalose, or xylitol.
Acid production from gentiobiose and D-turanose is delayed.
Acid production from amygdalin, arbutin, D-glucitol, gluconate, ribitol, and L-xylose varies with the strain.
The DNA G+C content is 48.0 to 48.3 mol% (as determined by HPLC).
The type strain is strain DSM 6035.
